sentences.sContent: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.sCn: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

sentences.sContent: ...Why do many women in rich countries compromise by having only one child...
...They often compromise by having just one child...
...Primary care physicians who refuse to compromise quality are either driven out of business or to cash-only practices...

remMethod.val: com(共同) ＋ promise(保证) → 相互保证 → 妥协

trans.tranCn: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
trans.tranOther: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
